name.text: 23.6.3.1 Properties of the complex Fourier coefficients

questiontext.text:
Properties of the complex Fourier coefficients

Using properties of the trigonometric Fourier coefficients \(a_n\), \(b_n\) we can readily deduce the following results for the \(c_n\) coefficients:

1. \(c_0=\dfrac{a_0}{2}\) is always real

2a. Suppose the periodic function \(f(t)\) is even so that all \(b_n\) are zero. Then, since in the complex form the \(b_n\) arise as the imaginary part of \(c_n\), it follows that for \(f(t)\) even the coefficients \(c_n\) (\(n=\pm 1,\pm 2,\ldots\)) are wholly real.

2b. Suppose the periodic function \(f(t)\) is odd so that all \(a_n\) are zero Since, for an odd periodic function the Fourier coefficients \(a_n\) (which constitute the real part of \(c_n\)), then in this case the complex coefficients \(c_n\) are wholly imaginary.

3. Since \[ c_n=\dfrac{1}{T}\int_{-\frac{T}{2}}^\frac{T}{2}f(t) e^{-i n\omega_0t}dt \] then if \(f(t)\) is even, \(c_n\) will be real, and we have two possible methods for evaluating \(c_n\):

a) Evaluate the integral above as it stands i.e. over the full range \(\left(-\dfrac{T}{2},\ \dfrac{T}{2}\right)\). Note carefully that the second term in the integrand is neither an even nor an odd function so the integrand itself is \[ (\text{ even function})\times (\text{ neither even nor odd function})=\ \text{ neither even nor odd function.}\] Thus we cannot write \[ c_n=\frac{2}{T}\int_0^{T/2} f(t) e^{- i n\omega_0 t} \ dt\]

b) Put \(e^{- i n\omega_0t}=\cos n\omega_0t- i\sin n\omega_0t\) so \[ \begin{eqnarray*}f(t) e^{- i n\omega_0t}=f(t)\cos n\omega_0 t- i f(t)\sin n\omega_0 t&=&(\text{ even})(\text{ even})- i (\text{ even})(\text{ odd}) \\ &=&(\text{ even})-i (\text{ odd}). \end{eqnarray*} \] Hence \[c_n=\dfrac{2}{T}\int_{0}^\frac{T}{2}f(t)\cos n\omega_0t\ dt=\dfrac{a_n}{2}.\]

4. If \(f(t+\dfrac{T}{2})=-f(t)\) then of course only odd harmonic coefficients \(c_n \left(n=\pm1,\pm 3,\pm 5,\ldots\right)\) will arise in the complex Fourier series just as with trigonometric series.
